title: Bharat Heavy Electricals fourth-quarter profit more than doubles, but misses expectations
text:
(Reuters) - State-run power plant equipment maker Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd’s fourth-quarter net profit more than doubled from a year earlier, but missed analysts’ expectations.
Net profit rose to 4.57 billion rupees ($67.35 million) in the quarter ended March 31, from 2.16 earlier, the company said on Tuesday.
Analysts on average had expected a profit of 5.19
The company incurred tax expenses of around 6.82 billion rupees for the quarter.
Total revenue from operations fell 1 percent to 101.44 billion rupees.
($1 = 67.8550 by Jessica Kuruthukulangara and Arnab Paul Subhranshu Sahu
